title: Ministry of Transparency, Supervision and Control
text: The Ministry of Transparency, Supervision and Control (<a href="Portuguese%20language">Portuguese</a>: "Ministério da Transparência, Fiscalização e Controle") is a <a href="Cabinet%20of%20Brazil">cabinet</a>-level <a href="federal%20government%20of%20Brazil">federal</a> <a href="list%20of%20federal%20institutions%20of%20Brazil">ministry</a> created on May 12, 2016. The then <a href="acting%20president">acting president</a> of <a href="Brazil">Brazil</a>, <a href="Michel%20Temer">Michel Temer</a>, created the ministry under Provisional Measure 726/2016. The responsibilities of the former <a href="Comptroller%20General%20of%20Brazil">Comptroller General of Brazil</a> were transferred to the ministry. <a href="Fabiano%20Silveira">Fabiano Silveira</a>, its first minister, resigned on May 30, 2016. From May 30 to June 1, <a href="Carlos%20Higino">Carlos Higino</a> was the interim minister, and on June 1, <a href="Torquato%20Jardim">Torquato Jardim</a> was installed as the new Transparency Minister.
